channel.title: How to make a place a safe place not wild!
channel.description: How can I make a wild place safe![br][size=1]Posted on: October 07, 2007, 05:28:31 PM[/size][hr]someone help me

item.title: How to make a place a safe place not wild!
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

Wow, possibly the most useless post I’ve ever seen mammoth. Don’t be a smartass.

You have to search in your client for

public boolean nonWild() {

Then there will be a list of coords. They are as follows:

(absX >= ###1  && absX <= ###2 && absY >= ###3  && absY <= ###4 )

###1 = The X coords of the most south west corner of the ‘nonwild box’
###2 = The X coords of the most north east corner of the ‘nonwild box’
###3 = The Y coords of the most south west corner of the ‘nonwild box’
###4 = The Y coords of the most north east corner of the ‘nonwild box’
Here is a small diagram of the ‘box’
|---------X2,Y2
|--------- |
|--------- |
X1, Y1----------|
My ascii art sucks. But you take the coords of those two locations and it creates the area of non wild.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a place a safe place not wild!
